intro: Dissochaeta anceps, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a composite head that resembles a single flower, and it produces small, ribbed, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Dissochaeta anceps is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and forest edges.
